rules.message: Haplotype matches *17 (increased function), however due to the lack of coverage for *4B we can't also rule out this position (no function).
We have detected *1/*3A. Most likely the diplotype is *1/*3A but  *3B/*3C can't be ruled out.
CPIC table refers to the reverse strand.
This haplotype only uses a single position, and may not be applicable  to all populations.
This genes relies on a multiple repeat to differentiate between several star allelles.  Some technologies may struggle to make this call accurately.
We have detected matches to *28 and *80.  These are usually seen in trans suggesting subject is *1/*28+80, however we cannot rule out *28/*80.
There was one or more functional variants in an intron; intronic variants are important for CYP3A5 so you want to do further testing.
